home.title: Eco Vision
home.description: Global warming is a phenomenon involving the increase in average terrestrial temperatures.< 0/> This has serious repercussions on our planet, causing glacier melting, sea-level rise, and extreme climate changes..< 1/> It is essential to monitor and understand these data to take preventive measures.

co2.title: CO2 Levels
co2.description: Excess CO2 in the atmosphere is one of the main causes of climate change. This greenhouse gas traps heat in the atmosphere, leading to global temperature increases.
impacts: Extreme weather events like hurricanes and droughts
solutions: Limit CO2 emissions through environmental policies
Promote renewable energy use
Support carbon capture and storage technologies
Adopt sustainable consumption and lifestyles

methane.title: Methane Emissions
methane.description: Methane is a powerful greenhouse gas with a much higher warming potential than CO2. It is emitted mainly through agriculture, fossil fuel production, and organic waste decomposition.
impacts: Human health impacts due to air pollution
solutions: Limit methane emissions through environmental policies
Adopt methane capture and storage technologies
Promote sustainable agricultural practices
Implement waste management to reduce anaerobic decomposition

no2.title: Nitrous Oxide Emissions
no2.description: Nitrous oxide (N2O) is a potent greenhouse gas primarily emitted through agricultural activities and industrial processes.
impacts: Formation of smog and acid rain
Damage to vegetation and aquatic ecosystems
solutions: Limit NO2 emissions through environmental policies
Promote the use of low-emission or electric vehicles
Adopt industrial filtering technologies
Educate the population on the risks associated with NO2

temperature.title: Global Temperature Rise
temperature.description: Global warming refers to the increase in Earth's average surface temperature, oceans, and atmosphere caused mainly by human activities.
impacts: Increase in vector-borne diseases like malaria
solutions: Reduce greenhouse gas emissions
Use renewable energy like solar and wind
Reforest and conserve forests
Adopt sustainable agricultural practices

ocean.title: Ocean Warming
ocean.description: Oceans regulate Earth's temperature by absorbing excess heat. However, increasing emissions are causing the oceans to warm, reducing their ability to absorb heat.
impacts: Sea-level rise due to thermal expansion
Marine biodiversity loss and species migration
Ocean acidification damaging corals and marine ecosystems
Reduced ocean capacity to absorb excess heat
solutions: Invest in low-emission technologies
Reduce the environmental impact of maritime transport
Protect and restore marine ecosystems like mangroves and coral reefs
Raise public awareness about the importance of oceans in regulating climate
